result.execSummary:
The defendant Eric C Ewing was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Eric C Ewing is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Eric C Ewing was found guilty of Possess w/Intent-THC (<=200 grams), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Must report to probation by close of business on Tuesday, December 15, 2015. 
Defendant may apply for early discharge after 2 years if he complied with all terms of probation and secures recommendation from the probation agent.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is allowed to expire or is revoked with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge and provide current financial information.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for any balances due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.
Must complete any and all evaluations, counseling, treatment and follow-up recommended by Probation Agent. Must submit DNA sample and pay the surcharge.

timeConds.notes:
Must report to Jail Monday, December 28, 2015 by 4:00 PM. Court grants 4 days credit to be applied to conditional jail sentence.
01/12/2016 AMENDED - COURT GRANTS WORK RELEASE

supervisions.notes:
Dodge Correctional Institution as reception facility. 
Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.  Defendant is not eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.

superMiscConds.notes: Any financial obligations that are due today to be paid as a condition of extended supervision. If probation or extended supervision is allowed to expire or is revoked with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge and provide current financial information.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for any balances due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

Must complete any and all evaluations, counseling, treatment and follow-up recommended by Probation Agent.  Order for DNA given to the defendant in court. Must report to Barron County Jail immediately, to submit DNA sample.

judgments.dispoDesc: Probation is revoked and sentence is imposed

records.addlTxt: 09:04 AM Defendant Eric C Ewing in court, in custody.  Eric C Ewing appeared by video means.   Drug Court Team present in court by Zoom Video.  This covers cases 16CF162 & 15CF95.  Court relates DE has been terminated from the Treatment Court Program.

09:53 AM Defendant Eric C Ewing in court in person.  Drug Court Team present in court by Zoom Video. This covers cases 16CF162 & 15CF95. DE relates regarding topic he was spoken to about last week regarding women.  Court relates.  DE relates regarding smart start violation.  He fully admits it and takes responsibility. Court discusses the consequences of having even one drink.  DE states he is committed to trying to regain and maintain sobriety.  The team has modified smart start testing to 4 times to day.  DE to write a paper on what lead to having a drink.  DE will be required to perform 8 hours of community service which will need to be completed in two weeks.  Dan McNamara relates sober day has reset.  Ron relates.  

CC: Dan McNamara

cc:  Dan McNamara  Treatment Court Hearing scheduled for January 12, 2021 at 09:00 am.

09:24 AM Defendant Eric C Ewing in court. Drug Court Team present in court by Zoom means.  Court reporter appears by Zoom video.
COVERS 15CF95 & 16CF162.
Living with core values of responsibility, honesty, integrity, and humility.  Meetings are made and documented. UAs taken on time and passed.  Work hours verified.

Said he had a plan this past week where he waited 30 seconds and got his mind on something else to avoid thoughts of wanting to take a drink.
Did a 7 page assignment that came in handy.  It's not easy, but he accomplished his goal to not drink.
Since having classes with Ron, he is in compliance now and still learning.
Talked about being humble and that humility is hard.
Volunteered to work on New Years and also will go to a meeting.


Name in Star Jar.

CC: Dan McNamara


  Treatment Court Hearing scheduled for January 5, 2021 at 09:00 am.

09:41 AM Defendant Eric C Ewing in court.   Drug Court Team present in court by Zoom video means.  Staci Lundmark, Court Reporter, appears by Zoom video means.
COVERS 15CF95 & 16CF162.
Living with core values of responsibility, honesty, integrity, and humility.  Meetings are made and documented. UAs taken on time and passed.  Work hours verified.

Working on Relapse Prevention right now.  Does not like the holidays as his family is not here and will be working on Christmas, but will get a meeting in also.
Did a Secret Santa for someone at the church and bought gifts for their son, went shopping, and felt good about it.  
Paid the bill in full that he said he would pay for last week for Smartstart.  Had a bad attitude about it, but realized with God's help that he has a 2nd chance in drug court and stopped complaining about it.  Said he had to adjust his attitude about it and realized to change his attitude.  Realizing it was his fault anyway for not paying the bill and kept his word and said he was going to pay the bill and he did.
Court relates on being humble and not being rude and apologize if he was cranky with Kara.  

Name in Star Jar

CC:  Dan McNamara



  Treatment Court Hearing scheduled for December 29, 2020 at 09:00 am.

09:24 AM Defendant Eric C Ewing in court.  -Drug Court Team present in court by Zoom means.  
COVERS 15CF95 & 16CF162.
Living with core values of responsibility, honesty, integrity, and humility.  Meetings are made and documented. UAs taken on time and passed.  Work hours verified.

Started working in sanitation at JOTS and has been working everyday, but he's still able to get sleep and meetings in also.
Didn't turn in meeting documentation to Dan until late last night and explains.  Court advises verification has to be to Dan by noon on Monday.  Dan relates he texted Eric yesterday at 11:00 a.m. but didn't hear a response until late last night.  Dan said there's no excuse and the meeting notes are due every Monday by noon.
Court relates there's an unpaid bill from Smartstart for $250.00 and questions Eric on that.  Eric explains the bill was from several years ago and court advises him to pay it.  Eric will pay smart start in full today.

Living with core values of responsibility, honesty and humility.  Meetings are made and documented. UAs taken on time and passed.  Work hours verified.
Eric relates he moved faster than he should have moved out of the TLP as he wanted the ankle bracelet off and has been having issues with his landlord.
Not in self-run will riot mode anymore and realizes he needs help, can't do it alone, and has been listening to advice the team gives him.


Name in Star Jar

09:09 AM Defendant Eric C Ewing in court by Zoom video means.  Drug Court Team present in court by Zoom means.  
Living with core values of responsibility, honesty and humility.  Meetings are made and documented. UAs taken on time and passed.  Work hours verified.
COVERS 15CF95 & 16CF162.

Eric talked about not beating himself up about making mistakes, went to a couple of meetings on Thanksgiving and did some reflection on his life and circumstances.
Court advises Eric to be more of a listener instead of a talker and to say less and listen more.
Dan appreciated Eric's call about job opportunities and advise on what the best choice for him would be.
Court relates on another participants comment about not being able to control their addiction, but they can control their choices.

Name in Star Jar

COVERS 15CF95 &16CF162.

Eric relates he had a drink on Saturday night, has been struggling with addiction, but has been going to meetings.
Reads paper he wrote this morning to the court that he can't quit on his own and needs help.  
Court advises Eric on his answers to questions posed to him, and he can't be over-confident or arrogant but needs to surrender and humble himself.


No Star this week.

CC:  Dan McNamara  Treatment Court Hearing scheduled for December 1, 2020 at 09:00 am.

09:01 AM Defendant Eric C Ewing in court. Drug Court Team present in court by Zoom means.  
COVERS 15CF95 AND 16CF162.
Living with core values of responsibility, honesty and humility.  Meetings are made and documented.
UAs taken on time and passed.  Work hours verified.

Eric talked about trying to rent a new place and being honest with landlord about his record, but the meeting with them didn't end well and he wanted to drink; but didn't.  Court congratulates Eric for not drinking.
Is still living at the TLP house, but is still thinking about moving to an apartment.
Court wants Eric to work on two things: What are the most important things he needs to focus on, and to be patient.
Needs to work on getting a sponsor.

Defendant Eric C Ewing in court with attorney Ryan Joseph Raymond.  Russell Edward Berg appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense makes clarification to PSI. State makes recommendation. Defense makes argument. Defendant makes statement.

Court relates and orders:
SW
3 Yrs Probation - must report by close of business Tuesday, December 15, 2015.
Defendant may apply for early discharge after 2 years if he complies with all terms of Probation and secures recommendation of Probation Agent.
Must complete any and all evaluations, counseling, treatment and follow-up recommended by Probation Agent.
60 days conditional jail to commence Monday, December 28, 2015 by 4:00 p.m.
4 days jail credit to be applied towards conditional jail time.
Court costs.
DNA sample and surcharge. 

Voter's rights given.  
Order for DNA given to the defendant in court.
Risk Assessment for PSI
Count 2 - Dismissed, Counts 3-5 Dismissed and read-in.

Defendant Eric C Ewing in court with attorney Ryan Joseph Raymond.  Russell Edward Berg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Raymond recites agreement.  Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights presented and discussed.  Guilty plea entered to Count 1.  The Court finds plea is knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily given and finds the defendant guilty.  Count 2 is Dismissed.  Counts 3, 4 and 5 are Dismissed and Read In.  Court orders PSI.  Bond continued.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 11, 2015 at 11:15 am.
